means: 开拓殖民地，移民于殖民地( colonize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: For more than 400 years, we were a colonized people.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们经受过400多年的殖民统治。

sentence.Network_en: The area was then colonized by scrub.
The area was colonized by the Vikings.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一地区曾沦为维京人的殖民地。

PerfectNetExp.abs: colonize 移生, colonized 集聚, colonized 殖民化
Ghana was colonized as the Gold Coast by the British .迦纳曾被英国作为黄金海岸，是其殖民地。
Europeans colonized Africa in the 17 th century ., 欧洲人在 17 世纪把非洲变为殖民地.

...人体吸收营养物质的能力，缩短食道运送时间，降低导致肠癌 (colon cancer) 的风险。

entry.tran: 在…开拓殖民地;将…建成殖民地
entry.def: If people colonize a foreign country, they go to live there and take control of it.

example.ex: The first British attempt to colonize Ireland was in the twelfth century...
example.tran: 英国最早尝试在爱尔兰开拓殖民地是在12世纪。

example.ex: Liberia was never colonised by the European powers...
example.tran: 利比里亚从未沦落为欧洲强国的殖民地。

entry.def: When large numbers of animals colonize a place, they go to live there and make it their home.

example.ex: Toads are colonising the whole place.
example.tran: 蟾蜍把这整个地方都占为己有。

entry.def: When an area is colonized by a type of plant, the plant grows there in large amounts.

example.ex: The area was then colonized by scrub.

auth_sentence.content: Snailfish are thought to have colonized deep ocean trenches relatively recently, in evolutionary terms.
auth_sentence.res_content: Snailfish are thought to have colonized deep ocean trenches relatively recently, in evolutionary terms.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Snailfish are thought to have colonized deep ocean trenches relatively recently, in evolutionary terms.

auth_sentence.content: Spurned by the British as a colonial, from an uncouth continent, he exacted the perfect revenge: he colonized their imagination.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Spurned by the British as a colonial, from an uncouth continent, he exacted the perfect revenge: he colonized their imagination.
